thread.title: RAK police nab Asian drug smuggler
thread.title_full: RAK police nab Asian drug smuggler

title: RAK police nab Asian drug smuggler
text: Ahmed Shaaban /Ras Al Khaimah Filed on February 11, 2017 Share More > Vote RAK Police said they were alerted that an Asian drug dealer would be trying to bring in the drugs. The Ras Al Khaimah Police, in collaboration with the Ministry of Interior and RAK Customs, have foiled an attempt to smuggle a large quantity of morphine into the country. Col Adnan Ali Al Zaabi, director of the anti-narcotics department, RAK Police, said they were alerted that an Asian drug dealer would be trying to bring in the drugs. "Armed with the prosecution permission, a team was formed in coordination with the anti-narcotics directorate-general and the RAK Customs to set a trap and nab the suspect." The anti-narcotics team tracked down the suspect when he arrived at the RAK international airport. "The suspect tried to mislead the team but he was arrested." The officials seized morphine worth Dh100,000 from his possession. A few days ago, the RAK Police apprehended one of the biggest drug dealers in the country. "The Arab suspect used nick names to cover his real identity." A large amount of drugs were found on the suspect, and some other narcotics and white weapons were extracted from his car, Col Zaabi explained. He said the RAK Police will show zero tolerance to drug smugglers and dealers . "They are mainly targeting the young people, especially the Emiratis." Parents should take responsibility for protecting their children from the drug dealers, Col Al Zaabi stated. He said a drug abuser can be easily identified from a set of indications, spanning regular absence, staying outdoors for long hours, abnormal response and reactions, laziness and reddish eyes. Ahmed Shaaban Originally from Egypt, I have been in Dubai since December 2005. Before coming here, I worked as an English language instructor, chief En/Ar translator, proofreader, reporter in Egypt and Qatar. I have also worked as a reporter, correspondent and simultaneous translator with two satellite channels in Dubai. I have a masters degree in media, Cairo University, 2014, a bachelor degree in English language and translation, Ain Shams University, Cairo, 1996, and three post-graduate diplomas in English language and Instruction. With over 19 years of experience in translation, interpretation, EFL instruction, and reporting. I am interested in technology, aviation, politics, as well as community, parliament and defence issues. I enjoy reading, writing, exercising, and surfing the web. Share
